Integrating blogs and books into a quarto website

R
Author

Zulji, Amel

Published

January 30, 2026

On this page

  • Creating a website
  • Integrating a blog
  • Integrating a book
  • Wrapper

Quarto makes it remarkably easy to create, manage, and deploy a wide range of publishing projects. With a single command, one can generate websites, blogs, and books. Even more powerful is Quartoâ€™s ability to combine these individual projects into a single, coherent meta-project.

In this guide, I demonstrate how to build a personal website that seamlessly embeds both a standalone blog and a dedicated book.

Creating a website

First, we initialize the main website project.

quarto create project website myweb --quiet

This command generates the basic structure of a Quarto website.

myweb
â”œâ”€â”€ _quarto.yml
â”œâ”€â”€ about.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ index.qmd
â””â”€â”€ styles.css

Once rendered, we have a clean, functional landing page.

quarto render myweb
[1m[34m
[1/2] about.qmd[39m[22m
[1m[34m
[2/2] index.qmd[39m[22m

Output created: _site/index.html

Integrating a blog

Next, we add a blog within the website.

quarto create project blog myweb/myblog myblog --quiet

The command generates the basic structure of a Quarto blog and the website has now structure as follows:

myweb
â”œâ”€â”€ _quarto.yml
â”œâ”€â”€ _site
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ about.html
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.html
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ search.json
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ site_libs
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ bootstrap
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ clipboard
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ quarto-html
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ quarto-nav
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ quarto-search
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ styles.css
â”œâ”€â”€ about.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ index.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ myblog
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ _quarto.yml
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ about.qmd
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.qmd
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ posts
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ _metadata.yml
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ post-with-code
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ welcome
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ profile.jpg
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ styles.css
â””â”€â”€ styles.css

Now, we need to configure the main website to include the blog from sub directory. Since quarto blog itself is also a project of type website this configuration is pretty straight forward. We need to add 2 lines within myweb/_quarto.yml

project:
  type: website

website:
  title: "myweb"
  navbar:
    left:
      - href: index.qmd
        text: Home
      - about.qmd
1      - href: myblog/index.qmd
2  site-url: https://your-website-url.example.com

format:
  html:
    theme:
      - cosmo
      - brand
    css: styles.css
    toc: true
1
The link points to the blogâ€™s listing page and exposes the blog through the main siteâ€™s navigation.
2
This is for blogs RSS feed and the link should be adjusted. Read more here

With these changes in place, rendering the main website integrates the blog seamlessly. The blog now appears as part of the website navigation while remaining a fully functional Quarto blog with its own posts, listings, and feeds.

quarto render myweb
[1m[34m
[1/6] about.qmd[39m[22m
[1m[34m
[2/6] index.qmd[39m[22m
[1m[34m
[3/6] myblog/about.qmd[39m[22m
[1m[34m
[4/6] myblog/index.qmd[39m[22m
[1m[34m
[5/6] myblog/posts/post-with-code/index.qmd[39m[22m
[1m[34m
[6/6] myblog/posts/welcome/index.qmd[39m[22m

Output created: _site/index.html

Integrating a book

Finally we add book within the website

quarto create project book myweb/notes notes --quiet

The website structure now looks like this:

fs::dir_tree("myweb", recurse = 2)
myweb
â”œâ”€â”€ _quarto.yml
â”œâ”€â”€ _site
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ about.html
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.html

â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ myblog

Unlike blogs, Quarto books are not websites; they have their own rendering logic, chapter structure, and output directory. As a result, additional configuration is required.

project:
  type: website
  
1  pre-render: render_book.R

2  render:
    - "*.qmd"
    - "!notes/"

3  resources: "notes/_book".

website:
  title: "myweb"
  navbar:
    left:
      - href: index.qmd
        text: Home
      - about.qmd
      - href: myblog/index.qmd
4      - href: notes/_book/index.html
        text: notes

  site-url: https://your-website-url.example.com  


format:
  html:
    theme:
      - cosmo
      - brand
    css: styles.css
    toc: true
1
Pre-render the book with a custom R script (the content of the script is shown bellow). Here is the reason why we need to prerender the book: when we run quarto render on the main website, Quarto attempts to render every .qmd it finds using the websiteâ€™s global configuration. However, a book needs to be rendered using its own _quarto.yml to preserve its chapter structure and book-specific features.
2
Render all site files except the pre-rendered book folder. We exclude rendering book at this points because it is supposed to be prerendred within its own structure.
3
Treat the rendered book output as a static resource.
4
Link to the compiled HTML entry point for navigation.

Bellow is the r script that is used in the pre-rendering process.

1var1 <- Sys.getenv("QUARTO_PROJECT_RENDER_ALL")

2if (var1 == "") {.
  quit().
}

quarto::quarto_render(input = "book/")
1
A variable specifying whether whole project is to be rendered or not. Read more here.
2
If the varible is "" it means quarto requested rendering a single file. In that case pre-rendering of the book is stopped. This is supper immportant as it prevents rendering whole project even if rendering only a single file was requested. Without this, whenever you would type quarto render file.qmd it will render not only that file but rather everything.

With this configuration file, we render the website and we have fully functional website with embeded blog and fully functional book.

rm -r myweb

Wrapper

#!/bin/bash

# 1. Capture Arguments
if [ "$#" -ne 4 ]; then
    echo "Usage: $0 <target_dir> <web_name> <blog_name> <book_name>"
    echo "Example: $0 . 'My Professional Site' 'posts' 'guidebook'"
    exit 1
fi

TARGET_DIR=$1
WEB_NAME=$2
BLOG_NAME=$3
BOOK_NAME=$4

echo "--- Initializing Meta-Project: $WEB_NAME in $TARGET_DIR ---"

# Create the projects using [dir] [name], this avoids "$TARGET_DIR/$BLOG_NAME" as blog name in metadata
quarto create project website "$TARGET_DIR" "$WEB_NAME" --quiet --no-prompt
quarto create project blog "$TARGET_DIR/$BLOG_NAME" "$BLOG_NAME" --quiet --no-prompt
quarto create project book "$TARGET_DIR/$BOOK_NAME" "$BOOK_NAME" --quiet --no-prompt

# Create the render_book.R to prerender book
cat <<EOF > "$TARGET_DIR/render_book.R"
var1 <- Sys.getenv("QUARTO_PROJECT_RENDER_ALL")

if (var1 == "") {
    quit()
}

# Renders the book from its subdirectory relative to this script
quarto::quarto_render(input = "$BOOK_NAME/")
EOF

# configure main _quarto.yml to include blog and book
cat <<EOF > "$TARGET_DIR/_quarto.yml"
project:
  type: website
  pre-render: render_book.R
  render:
    - "*.qmd"
    - "!$BOOK_NAME/"

  resources: 
    - "$BOOK_NAME/_book"

website:
  title: "$WEB_NAME"
  site-url: https://your-website-url.example.com
  navbar:
    left:
      - href: index.qmd
        text: Home
      - about.qmd
      - href: $BLOG_NAME/index.qmd
        text: Blog
      - href: $BOOK_NAME/_book/index.html
        text: Book

format:
  html:
    theme: cosmo
    css: styles.css
    toc: true
EOF

echo "setup complete"
